title: A man sold two horses for 3000 each gaining 25% on the one and losing 25% on the other. What is his loss percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Suppose that…the purchase price of each horse is x .. First horse-- Gaining 25% =x . 25/100 =x /4 Selling price of first horse = x + x /4 =5 x /4 And…5 x / 4 =3000 x =2400 ( purchasing prise of first horse ) Second horse…25 % loss Loss on purchase price …x . 25 /100 =x /4 Than selling price will be x - x /4 =3 x /4 And 3 x /4= 3000 Than x =4000 (purchasing price of second horse) Total selling price = 3000 +3000 =6000 Total purchasing price =2400 + 4000 = 6400 Total loss …purchasing 6400 - selling6000 = 400 Loss percentage =100 × 400 /6400 =25 / 4 %
